ComicInfo.Title: Cover-up Lowdown; Anarchy = Panarchy; Korporate-Rex; Mr. Helpful; Public Enemy; 1871; You Rule the World!; Armageddon Outtahere!
ComicInfo.Notes: Tagged with the ninjas.walk.alone fork of ComicTagger 1.3.5 using info from Comic Vine on 2024-05-10 16:27:16. [CVDB148217] Tagged with ComicTagger 1.6.0a13.dev122 using info from Grand Comics Database on 2024-06-16 17:10:27. [Issue ID 356992]
ComicInfo.Summary:
Cover-up Lowdown: Infant convinces arriving aliens that Earth's inhabitants are too primitive to wisely use the aliens' offer of advanced technological knowledge. They depart.
Anarchy = Panarchy: Intricate rhyming strip riffing on the meaning of the word "anarchy".
Korporate-Rex: Allegorical strip of international corporations as battling dinosaurs
Mr. Helpful: Recursive tale of a wish to help world hunger delayed by the desire for a "little snack."
Public Enemy: A semi-allegorical account of the bust, impounding, and destruction of the artists' solo comic, Frescazizis, in the 1980s in the UK.
1871: A dramatized historical strip about the Paris Commune and its fate.
You Rule the World!: A discontinuous sequence of panels showing different choices culminating in the protagonist ruling the world, as he is the only one left.
Armageddon Outtahere!: Mistakenly thinking the world is ending, Tuttle and Bodkin lock themselves in an underground survivalist chamber, only to re-emerge 10 years later when the real end-of-the-world is unleashed.
